news.headline: Warner Bros. Discovery rejects Paramount Skydance's latest hostile bid
news.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery's board of directors rejects Paramount Skydance's revised hostile bid. The company says the offer is inferior to Warner's $82.7 billion merger agreement with Netflix. Netflix says it "welcomed" the company's ongoing commitment to the merger.
news.article_text:
Warner Bros. Discovery's board of directors on Wednesday rejected Paramount Skydance's revised hostile bid, saying that its terms are inferior to Warner's $82.7 billion merger agreement with Netflix.

"Our binding agreement with Netflix will offer superior value at greater levels of certainty, without the significant risks and costs Paramount's offer would impose on our shareholders," Warner Bros. Discovery's board said in a statement.

news.headline: Is CoStar (CSGP) Using Its New $1.5 Billion Buyback To Redefine Its Growth Story?
news.summary: CoStar Group announced 2026 guidance calling for US$3.78 billion to US $3.82 billion in revenue. The company also completed a US$500 million repurchase plan and approved a new US$1.50 billion buyback program. CoStar’s narrative
news.article_text:

news.article_text:

news.headline: Top media strategist on Netflix ending its war on sleep to battle against ‘an infinite number of monkeys’—or the Army of the Dead
news.article_text:
From the vantage point of 2025, Shapiro contends, Netflix’s $72 billion bid for Warner is a tacit admission that the battle on sleep was one thing, but the battle against social media and all the other distractions of the super-plugged-in-world are another. “Traditional media cannot win the time game,” he said, with the battle for consumer attention being lost to social platforms like YouTube , Roblox , and TikTok, he argued, where consumption has become “reflexive” rather than deliberate.

Streaming giant Netflix (NFLX 1.82%) is looking to get even larger and more powerful through its planned acquisition of Warner Bros., which is still part of Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD +2.17%). news.summary: You won't find one-hit wonders in top mutual fund Fidelity OTC Portfolio (FOCPX).  To earn a spot in Christopher Lin's top mutual fund, earnings need to grow fast every year. news.headline: Warner Bros. Discovery rejects Paramount Skydance's latest hostile bid
news.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery's board of directors rejects Paramount Skydance's revised hostile bid. The company says the offer is inferior to Warner's $82.7 billion merger agreement with Netflix. Netflix says it "welcomed" the company's ongoing commitment to the merger.
news.article_text:
Warner Bros. Discovery's board of directors on Wednesday rejected Paramount Skydance's revised hostile bid, saying that its terms are inferior to Warner's $82.7 billion merger agreement with Netflix.

"Our binding agreement with Netflix will offer superior value at greater levels of certainty, without the significant risks and costs Paramount's offer would impose on our shareholders," Warner Bros. Discovery's board said in a statement.

news.headline: Paramount Says Warner Bros. Cable Channels Are Worth Nothing
news.summary: Paramount Skydance Corp. reaffirmed its offer to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. The $30-a-share bid is superior to one from Netflix Inc. in part because the rival deal would hand investors stock in a cable-TV spinoff.
news.article_text:
Paramount Skydance Corp. reaffirmed its offer to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., insisting its $30-a-share bid is superior to one from Netflix Inc. in part because the rival deal would hand investors stock in a cable-TV spinoff that Paramount deems worthless.

news.headline: Some of Warner Bros' biggest investors are split on Paramount offer
news.summary: Investors have until Jan. 21 to accept Paramount's latest $108.4 billion proposal, paying them $30 a share. Warner Bros board says the offer is inferior to its ‌agreement to sell to Netflix.
news.article_text:
By Ross Kerber

Jan 8 (Reuters) - Some of Warner Bros Discovery's (WBD) biggest investors are split on Paramount Skydance's (PSKY) sweetened offer for the storied movie studio owner, giving the smaller media company a fighting chance at winning over shareholders.

news.headline: Warner Bros. Discovery’s board isn’t choosing a deal — it’s avoiding one
news.summary: Paramount’s proposal is not subtle. It is an all-cash tender offer at $30 per share. Shareholders know exactly what they are getting and what risks they are no longer bearing. The problem is not strategic disagreement. It's governance breakdown.
news.article_text:
